pr_title: Added some clarifying statements to readmes

timeline.message: added some clarifying statements to readme

timeline.bodyText: Maybe add a note that CDNs or other specific scenarios my have different formats? That could be too much for the README, though.
timeline.author: rickle-msft
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -105,6 +108,30 @@ Blob Storage is designed for:
 - Storing data for backup and restore, disaster recovery, and archiving
 - Storing data for analysis by an on-premises or Azure-hosted service
 
+### URL format
+Blobs are addressable using the following URL format:
+The following URL addresses a blob:
+https://myaccount.blob.core.windows.net/mycontainer/myblob
+
+#### Resource URI Syntax
+For the storage account, the base URI for blob operations includes the name of the account only:
+
+```$xslt
+https://myaccount.blob.core.windows.net
+```
+
+For a container, the base URI includes the name of the account and the name of the container:
+
+```$xslt
+https://myaccount.blob.core.windows.net/mycontainer
+```
+
+For a blob, the base URI includes the name of the account, the name of the container and the name of the blob:
+
+```$xslt
+https://myaccount.blob.core.windows.net/mycontainer/myblob
+```
+

replies.bodyText: yeah I'm thinking this is more for people using this for the first time? for more complex scenarios I'm assuming people will know what theyre doing
replies.author: gapra-msft

replies.bodyText: just added a note that this doesnt apply for more advanced scenarios like custom domain names
replies.author: gapra-msft

timeline.bodyText: Does that refer to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XSLT ? I wonder why such choice here.

replies.bodyText: tbh I copied it from the queue README
replies.author: gapra-msft

replies.bodyText: This is what it ends up generating as (take a look at the url part of the README) https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/tree/master/sdk/storage/azure-storage-queue
replies.author: gapra-msft

replies.bodyText:
It doesn't seem to bring any special formatting when I see preview of this page. Why don't we drop it?
It brings back some bad memories from the past.
replies.author: kasobol-msft
